alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 12:49PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Marys River Near Deeth affecting Elko County. Humboldt River At Comus affecting Elko County. Bruneau River At Rowland affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Marys River...including Deeth...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lower Humboldt...including Comus...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Marys River Near Deeth. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.8 feet, Minor to moderate lowland flooding occurs on lower mary`s river, with flooding of many rural roads near the river. Some streets in deeth flood, as well as basements and foundations of a few homes. This is about 800 cfs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning and continue rising to 7.1 feet late Friday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 05/18/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
